```{r}
library(qesR)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(knitr)
```

```{r}
master <- if (file.exists("qes_master.csv")) {
  read.csv("qes_master.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
} else {
  get_qes_master(assign_global = FALSE, strict = FALSE, quiet = TRUE)
}

master <- master %>%
  mutate(
    qes_year_num = suppressWarnings(as.integer(sub("^([0-9]{4}).*$", "\\1", qes_year))),
    vote_choice = trimws(as.character(vote_choice))
  )

# qes_crop_2007_2010 has no row-level year field.
master <- master %>%
  filter(qes_code != "qes_crop_2007_2010")

major_parties <- c("CAQ", "PLQ", "PQ", "QS")
```

## Table 1: major-party vote-choice shares by year

```{r}
vote_base <- master %>%
  filter(!is.na(qes_year_num), !is.na(vote_choice), nzchar(vote_choice))

vote_den <- vote_base %>%
  group_by(qes_year_num) %>%
  summarise(n_with_vote_choice = n(), .groups = "drop")

vote_party <- vote_base %>%
  filter(vote_choice %in% major_parties) %>%
  group_by(qes_year_num, vote_choice) %>%
  summarise(n_party = n(), .groups = "drop")

grid <- expand.grid(
  qes_year_num = sort(unique(vote_den$qes_year_num)),
  vote_choice = major_parties,
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)

vote_party <- merge(grid, vote_party, by = c("qes_year_num", "vote_choice"), all.x = TRUE, sort = TRUE)
vote_party$n_party[is.na(vote_party$n_party)] <- 0
vote_party <- merge(vote_party, vote_den, by = "qes_year_num", all.x = TRUE, sort = TRUE)

vote_party <- vote_party %>%
  mutate(
    share = ifelse(n_with_vote_choice > 0, n_party / n_with_vote_choice, NA_real_),
    se = ifelse(
      n_with_vote_choice > 0,
      sqrt(pmax(share * (1 - share), 0) / n_with_vote_choice),
      NA_real_
    ),
    ci_low = ifelse(!is.na(se), pmax(0, share - 1.96 * se), NA_real_),
    ci_high = ifelse(!is.na(se), pmin(1, share + 1.96 * se), NA_real_)
  )

vote_table <- vote_party %>%
  group_by(qes_year_num) %>%
  summarise(
    n_with_vote_choice = first(n_with_vote_choice),
    caq = 100 * share[vote_choice == "CAQ"],
    plq = 100 * share[vote_choice == "PLQ"],
    pq = 100 * share[vote_choice == "PQ"],
    qs = 100 * share[vote_choice == "QS"],
    .groups = "drop"
  ) %>%
  arrange(qes_year_num)

knitr::kable(
  vote_table %>%
    transmute(
      `Study year` = qes_year_num,
      `N with vote-choice item` = n_with_vote_choice,
      `CAQ (%)` = round(caq, 1),
      `PLQ (%)` = round(plq, 1),
      `PQ (%)` = round(pq, 1),
      `QS (%)` = round(qs, 1)
    ),
  digits = 1,
  caption = "Major-party vote-choice shares by year"
)
```

## Figure 1: major-party vote-choice trend

```{r, fig.alt="Line chart of vote-choice shares for CAQ, PLQ, PQ and QS across study years."}
vote_party$vote_choice <- factor(vote_party$vote_choice, levels = major_parties)

ggplot(vote_party, aes(x = qes_year_num, y = share, color = vote_choice, group = vote_choice)) +
  geom_ribbon(aes(ymin = ci_low, ymax = ci_high, fill = vote_choice), alpha = 0.15, linewidth = 0) +
  geom_line(linewidth = 1.1) +
  geom_point(size = 2.1) +
  geom_smooth(
    method = "loess",
    se = FALSE,
    span = 0.9,
    linewidth = 0.8,
    linetype = "dashed"
  ) +
  scale_color_manual(
    values = c(
      "CAQ" = "#12355b",
      "PLQ" = "#2c7fb8",
      "PQ" = "#b5651d",
      "QS" = "#7a3e2d"
    ),
    name = "Party"
  ) +
  scale_fill_manual(
    values = c(
      "CAQ" = "#12355b",
      "PLQ" = "#2c7fb8",
      "PQ" = "#b5651d",
      "QS" = "#7a3e2d"
    ),
    guide = "none"
  ) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = function(x) paste0(round(100 * x, 0), "%"), limits = c(0, 1)) +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = sort(unique(vote_party$qes_year_num))) +
  labs(
    title = "Major-party vote choice over time",
    x = "Study year",
    y = "Share of respondents"
  ) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 12) +
  theme(panel.grid.minor = element_blank())
```

## Notes

- Shares use respondents with a non-missing `vote_choice` value.
- Confidence intervals are binomial 95% intervals (normal approximation).
- The trend figure is restricted to CAQ, PLQ, PQ, and QS.
